topic.title: Adding a Logo Image in the Title Area

body.p: You can customize WebHelp Responsive or WebHelp Classic output to include a logo in the title area. It will be displayed before the publication title. You can also specify a URL that can be used to send users to a specific website when they click the logo image.
This customization can be done using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author or using a command line script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author.

section.title: Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.p:
To add a logo in the title area of your WebHelp output using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Edit the WebHelp transformation scenario, then open the Parameters tab.
Specify the path to your logo in the webhelp.logo.image parameter.
If you also want to add a link to your website when you click the logo image, set the URL in the webhelp.logo.image.target.url parameter.
Run the transformation scenario.

section.title: Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

note.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

section.p:
To add a logo in the title area of your WebHelp output using a script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Specify the path to your logo using the webhelp.logo.image parameter.
If you also want to add a link to your website when you click the logo image, set the URL using the webhelp.logo.image.target.url parameter.
Execute the transformation script.

For example:
Windows:
dita.bat -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.logo.image=c:\myLogo.jpg -Dwebhelp.logo.image.target.url=http://sample-site.com
Mac OS X/ Linux:
dita -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.logo.image=C:/myLogo.jpg -Dwebhelp.logo.image.target.url=http://sample-site.com
